channel.title: James Cameron's AVATAR

item.title: James Cameron's AVATAR
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
C00K3H:

but probably its a lot better than Delgo.

Obviously it’s going to be better than Delgo, it’s James Cameron, but the point is that it looks like a better Delgo - which is much, much, MUCH worse than looking nothing at all like Delgo.

And if by “less kiddy” you mean “targeted at 15 year old boys rather than 12 year old girls*” then I agree with you.

*or whatever the fuck Delgo’s target audience was supposed to be, I didn’t see it.

Read full topic

item.title: James Cameron's AVATAR
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
Dias:

All I seem to hear about this movie is James Cameron, James Cameron, James Cameron. The trailer was mediocre to lame. The plot seems silly and I don’t think it’s trying to be. And the special effects aren’t that great.

In short I agree with this entirely: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UacLvPiz–8

Yeah but you’re overlooking the simple fact that your opinion is totally worthless because you’re in the L4D2 boycott group.

If the man who brought us Terminator, Aliens, The Abyss and True Lies wants to make a film about big blue aliens fighting space marines in mech suits my arse is there. And the trailer rocked.

Read full topic

item.title: James Cameron's AVATAR
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
Giant blue aliens, unlike Savage Planet, look like they were designed by a closet furry. Really disappointing* that a film with this kind of art budget would settle for that.

This movie is going to appeal strongly to its demographic (13-16 year old boys) and will look great in 3d, but sadly it appears that being “good” isn’t in the cards. If it is going to “revolutionize” anything, it will be an interesting field test of how good a live actor shot in stereoscopic 3d will look interacting with stereoscopic digital characters. I do not believe that has been done extensively before.

*second opinion on the art direction

Read full topic

item.title: James Cameron's AVATAR
item.dc:creator: alltogethernow
item.description:
Sam Worthington needs to get in my pants RN.
Also I’m already feeling attracted to the blue aliens.

The only problem I forsee is how cartoony they look when put next to a human.

It hasn’t suspended my disbelief successfully, at least in the trailer.

But I’ll still see the movie opening weekend.

item.title: James Cameron's AVATAR
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
JohnDillinger:

At first i thought you were talking about someones avatar when i read the thread title, then i thought you were talking about the “Avatar: The Last Air Bender” movie, and now i have come to my senses and see you are talking about a movie which sounds strangely close to “Halo”.

Which in turn always sounded to me like Larry Niven’s “Ringworld” crossed with James Cameron’s “Aliens” anyway, so I guess that takes it full circle.

Read full topic
